SEARCH
Module org.example.cs_213_project_iii
Package impl

Class Schedule

java.lang.Object
impl.Schedule
public class Schedule extends Object
Manages the schedule of fitness classes, including loading classes from a file, growing the internal storage as needed, and printing the schedule. Classes are identified and managed based on different attributes such as class name, instructor, time, and location.
Author:
Sasanka Paththameistreege

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Schedule()
    Constructs an empty Schedule with an initial capacity for fitness classes.

  • Constructor Details

    • Schedule

      public Schedule()
      Constructs an empty Schedule with an initial capacity for fitness classes.

  • Method Details

    • load

      public void load(File file) throws FileNotFoundException
      Loads fitness classes from a specified file into the schedule. The file format should match the expected pattern for class information, including the class name, instructor, time, and location.
      Parameters:
      file - The file from which to load the fitness classes.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the specified file does not exist.

    • getScheduleString

      public String getScheduleString()
      Generates and returns a string representation of the current schedule of fitness classes. The string includes details such as class information, instructor name, time, and studio location for each class. If no classes are scheduled, a message indicating this is returned instead.
      Returns:
      A formatted string listing all scheduled fitness classes and their details, or a message indicating that no classes are scheduled.

    • printClassWithAttendees

      public String printClassWithAttendees()
      Generates and returns a string representation of fitness classes along with their registered attendees and guests. For each class, the method lists its details (class information, instructor, time, studio location) followed by the names of all registered members and guests, if any. If no classes are scheduled, a message indicating this is returned instead.
      Returns:
      A formatted string detailing all fitness classes with their attendees and guests, or a message indicating that no classes are scheduled.

    • findClassByCriteria

      public FitnessClass findClassByCriteria(Offer offer, Instructor instructor, Location location)
      Searches for a fitness class matching specific criteria including offer, instructor, and location.
      Parameters:
      offer - The class offer to match.
      instructor - The instructor to match.
      location - The location to match.
      Returns:
      The matching FitnessClass or null if no match is found.

    • checkForMemberTimeConflict

      public boolean checkForMemberTimeConflict(Member member, Time newClassTime)
      Checks for a time conflict between a member's already registered fitness classes and a new class time. This method iterates through all registered classes of the given member and compares their times with the time of a new class being considered for registration. It is used to ensure that members do not register for overlapping classes.
      Parameters:
      member - The member whose registered classes are to be checked for a time conflict.
      newClassTime - The time of the new class being considered for registration.
      Returns:
      true if there is a time conflict, meaning the member has already registered for a class at the new class's time; false otherwise.

    • getClasses

      public ArrayList<FitnessClass> getClasses()
      Retrieves a list of all scheduled fitness classes. This method goes through the array of classes and collects all non-null fitness class objects into an ArrayList. This allows for easy access to all current classes in the schedule, which can be useful for displaying class information or performing other operations that require a list of classes.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing all non-null FitnessClass objects currently scheduled. If there are no classes, returns an empty list.

    • getNumClasses

      public int getNumClasses()
      Retrieves the total number of fitness classes currently scheduled. This method provides a simple way to access the count of classes managed by the class scheduler.
      Returns:
      The total number of scheduled fitness classes.
